alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Harrison; Taylor (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 11:01AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Doddridge, northwestern Taylor and northern Harrison Counties through 1130 AM EST... At 1101 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Salem, or 11 miles west of Clarksburg, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Shinnston, Salem, Lumberport, Enterprise, Wallace, Meadowbrook and Wolf Summit. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 127 and 128. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 64 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
